page.title: 06WOODLANDS OF NORTH FAREHAM.
page.content: There are about 12 copses in North Fareham,varying in size from 0.5ha up to 25ha.Chancellor's Copse typically has a mixture of oak,silver birch, beech,Scot's pine,ash,lime and hawthorn.In some places the woods have been coppiced,i.e.the trees have been cut right back to encourage much new growth.Part of Dash wood is a coniferous plantation;the wood from here was once used to make log cabins. Locals use the public footpaths for recreation such as country walks, walking the dog,bmx bikes and motorbike scrambling.The woods are home for a great variety of wild animals,especially deer,and birds. Wickham Common,an area of unfenced rough grassland,also has isolated clumps of trees and shrubs.
